item.title: Nature Water | 湿地保护和恢复在整个欧洲河流域清除氮中的重要作用
item.description:
标题: The important role of wetland conservation and restoration in nitrogen removal across European river basins

作者: L. E. Bertassello; N. B. Basu; J. Maes; B. Grizzetti; A. La Notte; L. Feyen

摘要（谷歌翻译）
在欧洲，氮的过多投入威胁生态系统和公共卫生。湿地充当天然过滤器，去除多余的养分并保护下游水域。使用有关氮盈余和湿地分布的高分辨率数据，我们估计现有的欧洲湿地每年消除1,092±95 kt的氮。恢复历史上有27％的湿地用于农业（占土地面积的3％），旨在用于高氮输入区域，可能会将当前的氮负荷降低到海上的36％，但可能会给农业生产力带来潜在的成本。一项更有效的策略是针对预计将在2040年放弃的农田的湿地恢复，从而减少了22％的负载，并使莱茵河，埃尔伯和维斯提拉等主要河流能够满足农业影响最小的水质目标。我们的发现凸显了湿地恢复是一种具有成本效益的，与政策相关的解决方案，如果以空间为目标，可以提供重大的水质改进，同时支持欧盟在气候，生物多样性和农业可持续性方面的广泛目标。

英文摘要
In Europe, excessive inputs of nitrogen threaten ecosystems and public health. Wetlands act as natural filters, removing excess nutrients and protecting downstream waters. Using high-resolution data on nitrogen surplus and wetland distribution, we estimate that existing European wetlands remove 1,092 ± 95 kt of nitrogen per year. Restoring 27% of wetlands historically drained for agriculture (3% of land area), targeted in high nitrogen input areas, could reduce current nitrogen loads to the sea by 36%, but with potential costs to agricultural productivity. A more efficient strategy targets wetland restoration on farmlands projected to be abandoned by 2040, yielding a 22% load reduction and enabling major rivers such as the Rhine, Elbe and Vistula to meet water quality targets with minimal agricultural impact. Our findings highlight wetland restoration as a cost-effective, policy-relevant solution that, if spatially targeted, can deliver major water quality improvements while supporting the European Union’s broader goals on climate, biodiversity and agricultural sustainability.
